segment.source: Identify Operating System Settings (Windows 10)
segment.target: Identify Operating System Settings (Windows 10)

segment.source: Identify Operating System Settings
segment.target: Identify Operating System Settings

segment.source: Identify Operating System Settings
segment.target: Identify Operating System Settings

segment.source: When planning for your migration, you should identify which operating system settings you want to migrate and to what extent you want to create a new standard environment on each of the computers.
segment.target: When planning for your migration, you should identify which operating system settings you want to migrate and to what extent you want to create a new standard environment on each of the computers.

segment.source: User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 enables you to migrate select settings and keep the default values for all others.
segment.target: User State Migration Tool (USMT) 10.0 enables you to migrate select settings and keep the default values for all others.

segment.source: The operating system settings include the following:
segment.target: The operating system settings include the following:

segment.source: Apperance.
segment.target: Apperance.

segment.source: This includes items such as wallpaper, colors, sounds, and the location of the taskbar.
segment.target: This includes items such as wallpaper, colors, sounds, and the location of the taskbar.

segment.source: Action.
segment.target: Action.

segment.source: This includes items such as the key-repeat rate, whether double-clicking a folder opens it in a new window or the same window, and whether you need to single-click or double-click an item to open it.
segment.target: This includes items such as the key-repeat rate, whether double-clicking a folder opens it in a new window or the same window, and whether you need to single-click or double-click an item to open it.

segment.source: Internet.
segment.target: Internet.

segment.source: These are the settings that let you connect to the Internet and control how your browser operates.
segment.target: These are the settings that let you connect to the Internet and control how your browser operates.

segment.source: This includes items such as your home page URL, favorites, bookmarks, cookies, security settings, dial-up connections, and proxy settings.
segment.target: This includes items such as your home page URL, favorites, bookmarks, cookies, security settings, dial-up connections, and proxy settings.

segment.source: Mail.
segment.target: Mail.

segment.source: This includes the information that you need to connect to your mail server, your signature file, views, mail rules, local mail, and contacts.
segment.target: This includes the information that you need to connect to your mail server, your signature file, views, mail rules, local mail, and contacts.

segment.source: To help you decide which settings to migrate, you should consider any previous migration experiences as well as the results of any surveys and tests that you have conducted.
segment.target: To help you decide which settings to migrate, you should consider any previous migration experiences as well as the results of any surveys and tests that you have conducted.

segment.source: You should also consider the number of help-desk calls related to operating-system settings that you have had in the past, and are able to handle in the future.
segment.target: You should also consider the number of help-desk calls related to operating-system settings that you have had in the past, and are able to handle in the future.

segment.source: Also decide how much of the new operating-system functionality you want to take advantage of.
segment.target: Also decide how much of the new operating-system functionality you want to take advantage of.

segment.source: You should migrate any settings that users need to get their jobs done, those that make the work environment comfortable, and those that will reduce help-desk calls after the migration.
segment.target: You should migrate any settings that users need to get their jobs done, those that make the work environment comfortable, and those that will reduce help-desk calls after the migration.

segment.source: Although it is easy to dismiss migrating user preferences, you should consider that users can spend a significant amount of time restoring items such as wallpaper, screen savers, and other customizable user-interface features.
segment.target: Although it is easy to dismiss migrating user preferences, you should consider that users can spend a significant amount of time restoring items such as wallpaper, screen savers, and other customizable user-interface features.

segment.source: Most users do not remember how these settings were applied.
segment.target: Most users do not remember how these settings were applied.

segment.source: Although these items are not critical to migration success, migrating these items increases user productivity and overall satisfaction of the migration process.
segment.target: Although these items are not critical to migration success, migrating these items increases user productivity and overall satisfaction of the migration process.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about how to change the operating-system settings that are migrated, see User State Migration Tool (USMT) How-to topics.
segment.target: For more information about how to change the operating-system settings that are migrated, see User State Migration Tool (USMT) How-to topics.

segment.source: For information about the operating-system settings that USMT migrates, see What Does USMT Migrate?
segment.target: For information about the operating-system settings that USMT migrates, see What Does USMT Migrate?

segment.target: Related topics
